messageBody:
On 6/18/06, Stephen Smith <steve@...> wrote:
>
> Is there any situation in which multiple assertions per test can be
> justified? For example, talking to an expensive external resource that
> can't easily be mocked (e.g. third party hardware)?


Yes, a lot of my tests have multiple asserts as well.

The few times where I want to make sure that all the asserts are run
regarding of failures, I use booleans to defer the failure:

boolean containsTest = a.contains(b);
boolean dbTest = db.runQuery("SELECT ....");

if (! containsTest) { throw new AssertionError( ...) }
if (! dbTest) { throw new AssertionError(...) }

It's still a suspicious construct, in my opinion, but if you have really no
choice, that's one way of doing it...

--
